analyzed: pahīno kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati  vā tassa iva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca
translated: The underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion are not to be spoken of as either abandoned or not abandoned.

original: kāmarāgānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca pahīnā, no ca tassa tattha mānānusayo pahīno; paṭighānusayo
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca pahīnā no ca tassa tattha māna anusayo pahīno paṭigha anusayo
translated: For that same person in the sense-desire element and in two kinds of feeling the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to lust have been abandoned, but not the underlying tendency to conceit.

original: na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa🔽tattha vicikicchānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca pahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo🔽ca mānānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Arahato rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā
analyzed: na vattabbo pahīnoti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā tassa iva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa  tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca pahīnā kāma rāga anusayo  ca māna anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā arahataḥ rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā
translated: The underlying tendency to aversion is not to be spoken of as either abandoned or not abandoned. For that same person in painful feeling🔽the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to aversion and the underlying tendency to views have been abandoned, but the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to conceit are not to be spoken of as either abandoned or not abandoned. For one who is an Arahant in the element of form and in the formless element

original: tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca pahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca pahīnā kāma rāga anusayo
translated: the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to views have been abandoned, but the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion are not to be spoken of as either abandoned or not abandoned.

original: ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa
analyzed: ca paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā tassa iva puggalassa
translated: and the underlying tendency to resistance should not be said to be either abandoned or unabandoned.

original: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo
analyzed: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo
translated: In the case of that person, in the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element, the underlying tendency to uncertainty, the underlying tendency to lust for existence, and the underlying tendency to conceit

original: ca diṭṭhānusayo ca pahīnā; paṭighānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā.🔽Tasseva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo ca paṭighānusayo🔽ca diṭṭhānusayo ca pahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti
analyzed: ca diṭṭha anusayo ca pahīnā paṭigha anusayo na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā  tassa iva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo  ca diṭṭha anusayo ca pahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati
translated: are abandoned; but the underlying tendency to resistance should not be said to be either abandoned or unabandoned.

original: vā “appahīnā”ti vā …pe…. (Catukkamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: vā vā pe
translated: In the case of that person, in painful feeling, the underlying tendency to uncertainty, the underlying tendency to resistance, and the underlying tendency to false view are abandoned; but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desire and the underlying tendency to conceit should not be said to be either abandoned or unabandoned. … (Fourfold)

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca pahīnā tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo pahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca pahīnā tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayo pahīno ti natthi
translated: In the case of one in whom the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desire, the underlying tendency to resistance, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to false view, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty are abandoned, is the underlying tendency to lust for existence abandoned? There is none.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha bhavarāgānusayo pahīno tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca pahīnāti?🔽Arahato rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha bhava rāga anusayo pahīno tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca pahīnā ati  arahataḥ rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo
translated: Or, when the underlying tendency to existence is abandoned in any given person in regard to any given realm, has the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to resentment, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty been abandoned in that person in regard to that realm?

original: ca vicikicchānusayo ca pahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā.
analyzed: ca vicikicchā anusayo ca pahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā
translated: In an Arahant in the fine-material and immaterial realms the underlying tendency to existence and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to uncertainty have been abandoned, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment have been abandoned or not abandoned.

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca pahīnā tassa tattha avijjānusayo pahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca pahīnā tassa tattha avijjā anusayo pahīno ti natthi
translated: When the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to uncertainty have been abandoned in any given person in regard to any given realm, has the underlying tendency to ignorance been abandoned in that person in regard to that realm? There is none.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha avijjānusayo pahīno tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca pahīnāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha avijjā anusayo pahīno tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca pahīnā ati
translated: Or, when the underlying tendency to ignorance has been abandoned in any given person in regard to any given realm, have the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to uncertainty been abandoned in that person in regard to that realm?

original: Arahato rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha avijjānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo
analyzed: arahataḥ rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha avijjā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo
translated: In one who is an Arahant, in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, ignorance-proclivity and conceit-proclivity and false- view-proclivity and doubt-proclivity are abandoned,

original: ca vicikicchānusayo ca pahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti🔽vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha avijjānusayo
analyzed: ca vicikicchā anusayo ca pahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati  vā appahīnā ati vā tassa iva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha avijjā anusayo
translated: but it cannot be said that lust-for-existence-proclivity and hostility-proclivity are either abandoned or not abandoned.

original: ca kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca pahīnā; paṭighānusayo
analyzed: ca kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca pahīnā paṭigha anusayo
translated: In the fine-material and immaterial dhammas of that same person, ignorance-proclivity and lust-for-existence-proclivity and conceit-proclivity and false-view-proclivity and doubt-proclivity are abandoned,

original: na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa
analyzed: na vattabbo pahīnoti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā tassa iva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa
translated: but it cannot be said that hostility-proclivity is either abandoned or not abandoned.

original: tattha avijjānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca pahīnā;
analyzed: tattha avijjā anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca pahīnā
translated: In the painful feeling of that same person, ignorance-proclivity and hostility-proclivity and false-view-proclivity and doubt-proclivity are abandoned,

original: kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. (Pañcakamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayaḥ ca māna anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā
translated: but it cannot be said that lust-for-existence-proclivity and conceit-proclivity are either abandoned or not abandoned.🔽In the two pleasant feelings of that same person, ignorance-proclivity and lust-for-existence-proclivity and conceit-proclivity and false-view-proclivity and doubt-proclivity are abandoned,🔽but it cannot be said that hostility-proclivity is either abandoned or not abandoned.

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo ca pahīnā tassa tattha avijjānusayo pahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo ca pahīnā tassa tattha avijjā anusayo pahīno ti natthi
translated: When anyone has abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to doubt, and the underlying tendency to lust for existence in any given realm, has he also abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance there? There is none.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha avijjānusayo pahīno tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo ca pahīnāti?🔽Arahato rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha avijjānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo🔽ca vicikicchānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo ca pahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha avijjā anusayo pahīno tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo ca pahīnā ati  arahataḥ rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha avijjā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo  ca vicikicchā anusayaḥ ca bhava rāga anusayaḥ ca pahīnā kāma rāga anusayaḥ ca paṭigha anusayaḥ
translated: Or when anyone has abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance in any given realm, has he also abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to doubt, and the underlying tendency to lust for existence there?

original: ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu
analyzed: ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā tassa iva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu
translated: In the case of one who is an Arahant, in the fine-material and immaterial realms he has abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to doubt, and the underlying tendency to lust for existence there, but it is not to be said that he has abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to aversion there.

original: vedanāsu tassa tattha avijjānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo
analyzed: vedanāsu tassa tattha avijjā anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo
translated: In the case of that same person, in the sense-desire element and in two of the three kinds of feeling, he has abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to doubt,🔽and the underlying tendency to lust for existence there, but it is not to be said that he has abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to aversion there.

original: ca vicikicchānusayo ca pahīnā; paṭighānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti🔽vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha avijjānusayo
analyzed: ca vicikicchā anusayo ca pahīnā paṭigha anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati  vā appahīnā ati vā tassa iva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha avijjā anusayo
translated: and the underlying tendency to uncertainty are abandoned, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to lust for being are either abandoned or unabandoned.

original: ca paṭighānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca pahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca
analyzed: ca paṭigha anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca pahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca
translated: In the case of that same person, when he is experiencing a painful feeling, his underlying tendency to ignorance and his underlying tendency to resentment and his underlying tendency to false view and his underlying tendency to uncertainty are abandoned, but it cannot be said that his underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and his underlying tendency to conceit and his underlying tendency to lust for being are either abandoned or unabandoned.

original: mānānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. (Chakkamūlakaṁ.)🔽Pahīnavāre anulomaṁ.🔽7.2.5.4. Paṭilomapuggala🔽Yassa kāmarāgānusayo appahīno tassa paṭighānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: māna anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā  anuloma  paṭiloma puggala  yassa kāma rāga anusayaḥ appahīno tassa paṭigha anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: In the section on the direct method in the chapter on the six kinds of persons, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires is abandoned in the four paths and the four fruits, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to conceit is either abandoned or unabandoned.🔽In the section on the reverse method in the chapter on the six kinds of persons, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires is abandoned in the four paths and the four fruits, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to conceit is either abandoned or unabandoned.🔽The underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires is abandoned in the four paths and the four fruits, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to lust for being is either abandoned or unabandoned.

original: Yassa vā pana paṭighānusayo appahīno tassa kāmarāgānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa kāmarāgānusayo appahīno tassa mānānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana paṭigha anusayaḥ appahīno tassa kāma rāga anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā  yassa kāma rāga anusayaḥ appahīno tassa māna anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: The underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires is abandoned in the four paths and the four fruits, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to conceit is either abandoned or unabandoned.🔽The underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires is abandoned in the four paths and the four fruits, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to lust for being is either abandoned or unabandoned.

original: Yassa vā pana mānānusayo appahīno tassa kāmarāgānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana māna anusayo appahīno tassa kāma rāga anusayo appahīno ti
translated: The underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires is abandoned in the four paths and the four fruits, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to conceit is either abandoned or unabandoned.🔽The underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires is abandoned in the four paths and the four fruits, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to conceit is either abandoned or unabandoned.

original: Anāgāmissa mānānusayo appahīno, no ca tassa kāmarāgānusayo appahīno. Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ mānānusayo ca appahīno kāmarāgānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: anāgāmissa māna anusayaḥ appahīno no ca tassa kāma rāga anusayaḥ appahīno tiṇṇam puggalānam māna anusayaḥ ca appahīno kāma rāga anusayaḥ ca appahīno
translated: In the case of one on the path to non-return, the underlying tendency to conceit has not yet been abandoned, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires has already been abandoned. In the case of the remaining three, both the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires have not yet been abandoned.

original: Yassa kāmarāgānusayo appahīno tassa diṭṭhānusayo …pe… vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa kāma rāga anusayo appahīno tassa diṭṭha anusayo pe vicikicchā anusayo appahīno ti
translated: “In the case of one in whom the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires has not yet been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to lust for views … the underlying tendency to conceit … the underlying tendency to lust for becoming … the underlying tendency to ignorance not yet been abandoned?”

original: Dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ kāmarāgānusayo appahīno, no ca tesaṁ vicikicchānusayo appahīno. Puthujjanassa kāmarāgānusayo ca appahīno vicikicchānusayo ca appahīno.🔽Yassa vā pana vicikicchānusayo appahīno tassa kāmarāgānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa kāmarāgānusayo appahīno tassa bhavarāgānusayo …pe… avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: dvinnam puggalānam kāma rāga anusayaḥ appahīno no ca tesam vicikicchā anusayaḥ appahīno puthujjanassa kāma rāga anusayo ca appahīno vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīno  yassa vā pana vicikicchā anusayaḥ appahīno tassa kāmarāga anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā  yassa kāma rāga anusayaḥ appahīno tassa bhava rāga anusayaḥ pe avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: In the case of two persons, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires has not yet been abandoned, but the underlying tendency to ignorance has already been abandoned. In the case of the remaining three, both the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to ignorance have not yet been abandoned.🔽“In the case of one in whom the underlying tendency to ignorance has not yet been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires not yet been abandoned?”🔽“In the case of one in whom the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires has not yet been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to lust for becoming … the underlying tendency to conceit … the underlying tendency to lust for views … the underlying tendency to ignorance not yet been abandoned?”

original: Yassa vā pana avijjānusayo appahīno tassa kāmarāgānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno tassa kāmarāga anusayaḥ appahīno ti
translated: “In the case of one in whom the underlying tendency to ignorance has not yet been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires not yet been abandoned?”

original: Anāgāmissa avijjānusayo appahīno, no ca tassa kāmarāgānusayo appahīno. Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ avijjānusayo ca appahīno kāmarāgānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: anāgāmissa avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno no ca tassa kāmarāga anusayaḥ appahīno tiṇṇam puggalānam avijjā anusayaḥ ca appahīno kāmarāga anusayaḥ ca appahīno
translated: In the non-returner the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned, but the underlying tendency to lust is abandoned. In three persons the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to lust are unabandoned.

original: Yassa paṭighānusayo appahīno tassa mānānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa paṭigha anusayaḥ appahīno tassa māna anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: In one in whom the underlying tendency to repugnance is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to conceit unabandoned?

original: Yassa vā pana mānānusayo appahīno tassa paṭighānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana māna anusayo appahīno tassa paṭigha anusayo appahīno ti
translated: Or in one in whom the underlying tendency to conceit is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to repugnance unabandoned?

original: Anāgāmissa mānānusayo appahīno, no ca tassa paṭighānusayo appahīno. Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ mānānusayo ca appahīno paṭighānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: anāgāmissa māna anusayaḥ appahīno no ca tassa paṭigha anusayaḥ appahīno tiṇṇam puggalānam māna anusayaḥ ca appahīno paṭigha anusayaḥ ca appahīno
translated: In the non-returner the underlying tendency to conceit is unabandoned, but the underlying tendency to repugnance is abandoned. In three persons the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to repugnance are unabandoned.

original: Yassa paṭighānusayo appahīno tassa diṭṭhānusayo …pe… vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa paṭigha anusayo appahīno tassa diṭṭha anusayo pe vicikicchā anusayo appahīno ti
translated: In one in whom the underlying tendency to repugnance is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to false view … to conceit … to lust … to hate unabandoned?

original: Dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ paṭighānusayo appahīno, no ca tesaṁ vicikicchānusayo appahīno. Puthujjanassa paṭighānusayo ca appahīno vicikicchānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: dvinnam puggalānam paṭigha anusayaḥ appahīno no ca tesam vicikicchā anusayaḥ appahīno puthujjanassa paṭigha anusayaḥ ca appahīno vicikicchā anusayaḥ ca appahīno
translated: In two persons the underlying tendency to repugnance is unabandoned, but the underlying tendency to lust is not unabandoned. In the worldling the underlying tendency to repugnance and the underlying tendency to lust are unabandoned.

original: Yassa vā pana vicikicchānusayo appahīno tassa paṭighānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana vicikicchā anusayaḥ appahīno tassa paṭigha anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: Or is it that when the underlying tendency to uncertainty is unabandoned the underlying tendency to resentment is unabandoned?

original: Yassa paṭighānusayo appahīno tassa bhavarāgānusayo …pe… avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa paṭigha anusayo appahīno tassa bhava rāga anusayo pe avijjā anusayo appahīno ti āmantā
translated: When the underlying tendency to resentment is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to lust for existence … the underlying tendency to ignorance unabandoned?

original: Yassa vā pana avijjānusayo appahīno tassa paṭighānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana avijjā anusayo appahīno tassa paṭigha anusayo appahīno ti
translated: Or is it that when the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned the underlying tendency to resentment is unabandoned?

original: Anāgāmissa avijjānusayo appahīno, no ca tassa paṭighānusayo appahīno. Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ avijjānusayo ca appahīno paṭighānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: anāgāmissa avijjā anusayo appahīno no ca tassa paṭigha anusayo appahīno tiṇṇam puggalānam avijjā anusayo ca appahīno paṭigha anusayo ca appahīno
translated: In the case of the non-returner the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned but not the underlying tendency to resentment. In the case of the three persons the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to resentment are unabandoned.

original: Yassa mānānusayo appahīno tassa diṭṭhānusayo …pe… vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa māna anusayo appahīno tassa diṭṭha anusayo pe vicikicchā anusayo appahīno ti
translated: When the underlying tendency to conceit is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to false view … the underlying tendency to uncertainty unabandoned?

original: Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ mānānusayo appahīno, no ca tesaṁ vicikicchānusayo appahīno. Puthujjanassa mānānusayo ca appahīno vicikicchānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: tiṇṇam puggalānam māna anusayaḥ appahīno no ca tesam vicikicchā anusayaḥ appahīno puthujjanassa māna anusayo ca appahīno vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīno
translated: In the case of the three persons the underlying tendency to conceit is unabandoned but not the underlying tendency to uncertainty. In the case of the worldling the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to uncertainty are unabandoned.

original: Yassa vā pana vicikicchānusayo appahīno tassa mānānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana vicikicchā anusayaḥ appahīno tassa māna anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: Or is it that when the underlying tendency to uncertainty is unabandoned the underlying tendency to conceit is unabandoned?

original: Yassa mānānusayo appahīno tassa bhavarāgānusayo …pe… avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa māna anusayaḥ appahīno tassa bhava rāga anusayo pe avijjā anusayo appahīno ti āmantā
translated: Has he who has not abandoned the inherent tendency to conceit not abandoned the inherent tendency to lust for becoming … the inherent tendency to ignorance? Yes.

original: Yassa vā pana avijjānusayo appahīno tassa mānānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa diṭṭhānusayo appahīno tassa vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno tassa māna anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā  yassa diṭṭha anusayaḥ appahīno tassa vicikicchā anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: Has he who has not abandoned the inherent tendency to ignorance not abandoned the inherent tendency to conceit? Yes.🔽Has he who has not abandoned the inherent tendency to wrong view not abandoned the inherent tendency to uncertainty? Yes.

original: Yassa vā pana vicikicchānusayo appahīno tassa diṭṭhānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā …pe….
analyzed: yassa vā pana vicikicchā anusayo appahīno tassa diṭṭha anusayo appahīno ti āmantā pe
translated: Has he who has not abandoned the inherent tendency to uncertainty not abandoned the inherent tendency to wrong view? Yes.

original: Yassa vicikicchānusayo appahīno tassa bhavarāgānusayo …pe… avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa vicikicchā anusayaḥ appahīno tassa bhava rāga anusayaḥ pe avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: Has he who has not abandoned the inherent tendency to uncertainty not abandoned the inherent tendency to lust for becoming … the inherent tendency to ignorance? Yes.

original: Yassa vā pana avijjānusayo appahīno tassa vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno tassa vicikicchā anusayaḥ appahīno ti
translated: Has he who has not abandoned the inherent tendency to ignorance not abandoned the inherent tendency to uncertainty?

original: Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ avijjānusayo appahīno, no ca tesaṁ vicikicchānusayo appahīno. Puthujjanassa avijjānusayo ca appahīno vicikicchānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: tiṇṇam puggalānam avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno no ca tesam vicikicchā anusayaḥ appahīno puthujjanassa avijjā anusayaḥ ca appahīno vicikicchā anusayaḥ ca appahīno
translated: The inherent tendency to ignorance has not been abandoned in three persons, but the inherent tendency to uncertainty has been abandoned in them. The inherent tendency to ignorance and the inherent tendency to uncertainty have not been abandoned in the worldling.

original: Yassa bhavarāgānusayo appahīno tassa avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa bhava rāga anusayaḥ appahīno tassa avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: Has he who has not abandoned the inherent tendency to lust for becoming not abandoned the inherent tendency to ignorance? Yes.

original: Yassa vā pana avijjānusayo appahīno tassa bhavarāgānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā. (Ekamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: yassa vā pana avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno tassa bhava rāga anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā ekamūlaka
translated: Or, if the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to lust for existence unabandoned?🔽In the case of the non-returner, the underlying tendency to lust for existence is unabandoned, but not the underlying tendency to ignorance. In the case of the other three, both are unabandoned.

original: Yassa kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā tassa mānānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa vā pana mānānusayo appahīno tassa kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnāti?
analyzed: yassa kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā tassa māna anusayo appahīno ti āmantā  yassa vā pana māna anusayo appahīno tassa kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā ati
translated: In the case of the once-returner, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires is unabandoned, but not the underlying tendency to conceit.🔽In the case of the other three, both are unabandoned.🔽In the case of the non-returner, the underlying tendency to conceit is unabandoned, but not the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires or to resentment. In the case of the other three, both the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and to resentment are unabandoned.

original: Anāgāmissa mānānusayo appahīno, no ca tassa kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā. Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ mānānusayo ca appahīno kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā.🔽Yassa kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā tassa diṭṭhānusayo …pe… vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: anāgāmissa māna anusayo appahīno no ca tassa kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā tiṇṇam puggalānam māna anusayo ca appahīno kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā  yassa kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā tassa diṭṭha anusayo pe vicikicchā anusayo appahīno ti
translated: In the case of the once-returner, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and to resentment are unabandoned, but not the underlying tendency to lust for existence, to conceit, to sensual desire, to resentment, to pride, or to ignorance.🔽In the case of the other three, all are unabandoned.

original: Dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā, no ca tesaṁ vicikicchānusayo
analyzed: dvinnam puggalānam kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā no ca tesam vicikicchā anusayo
translated: In the case of the non-returner, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and to resentment are unabandoned, but not the underlying tendency to lust for existence, to conceit, to views, to lust for existence, to ignorance, or to doubt.🔽In the case of the other three, all are unabandoned.

original: appahīno. Puthujjanassa kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā vicikicchānusayo ca appahīno.🔽Yassa vā pana vicikicchānusayo appahīno tassa kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnāti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā tassa bhavarāgānusayo …pe… avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: appahīno puthujjanassa kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīno  yassa vā pana vicikicchā anusayo appahīno tassa kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā ati āmantā  yassa kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā tassa bhava rāga anusayo pe avijjā anusayo appahīno ti āmantā
translated: In an ordinary person, the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion are unabandoned, but the underlying tendency to views is abandoned.🔽But if the underlying tendency to views is unabandoned, are the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion unabandoned?🔽In one in whom the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion are unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to desire for being unabandoned? … Is the underlying tendency to ignorance unabandoned?

original: Yassa vā pana avijjānusayo appahīno tassa kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnāti?🔽Anāgāmissa avijjānusayo appahīno, no ca tassa kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca
analyzed: yassa vā pana avijjā anusayo appahīno tassa kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā ati  anāgāmissa avijjā anusayo appahīno no ca tassa kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca
translated: But if the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned, are the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion unabandoned?🔽In a non-returner the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned, but the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion are abandoned.

original: appahīnā. Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ avijjānusayo ca appahīno kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo
analyzed: appahīnā tiṇṇam puggalānam avijjā anusayo ca appahīnaḥ kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo
translated: In three persons the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion are unabandoned.

original: ca appahīnā. (Dukamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: ca appahīnā dukamūlaka
translated: (The triad based on the root of the unprofitable.)

original: Yassa kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā tassa diṭṭhānusayo …pe… vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā tassa diṭṭha anusayo pe vicikicchā anusayo appahīno ti
translated: “Are the underlying tendencies to lust, to aversion, and to conceit unabandoned in one in whom the underlying tendency to views…to doubt is unabandoned?”

original: Dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā, no🔽ca tesaṁ vicikicchānusayo appahīno. Puthujjanassa kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo
analyzed: dvinnam puggalānam kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā no  ca tesam vicikicchā anusayo appahīno puthujjanassa kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo
translated: In two persons the underlying tendencies to lust, to aversion, and to conceit are unabandoned,

original: ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā vicikicchānusayo ca appahīno.🔽Yassa vā pana vicikicchānusayo appahīno tassa kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnāti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā tassa bhavarāgānusayo …pe… avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīno  yassa vā pana vicikicchā anusayo appahīno tassa kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā ati āmantā  yassa kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā tassa bhava rāga anusayo pe avijjā anusayo appahīno ti āmantā
translated: but not the underlying tendency to doubt. In an ordinary person the underlying tendencies to lust, to aversion, to conceit, and to doubt are unabandoned.🔽“But in one in whom the underlying tendency to doubt is unabandoned, are the underlying tendencies to lust, to aversion, and to conceit unabandoned?”🔽“Are the underlying tendencies to lust, to aversion, and to conceit unabandoned in one in whom the underlying tendency to lust for existence…to ignorance is unabandoned?”

original: Yassa vā pana avijjānusayo appahīno tassa kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana avijjā anusayo appahīno tassa kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā ati
translated: “But in one in whom the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned, are the underlying tendencies to lust, to aversion, and to conceit unabandoned?”

original: Anāgāmissa avijjānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā, no ca tassa kāmarāgānusayo ca
analyzed: anāgāmissa avijjā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā no ca tassa kāma rāga anusayo ca
translated: In one who is a Non-Returner the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit are unabandoned, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment are abandoned.

original: paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā. Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ avijjānusayo ca appahīno kāmarāgānusayo🔽ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā. (Tikamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yassa kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca appahīnā tassa vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.🔽Yassa vā pana vicikicchānusayo appahīno tassa kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca appahīnāti? Āmantā …pe…. (Catukkamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā tiṇṇam puggalānam avijjā anusayo ca appahīno kāma rāga anusayo  ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā tika mūlaka  yassa kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca appahīnā tassa vicikicchā anusayo appahīno ti āmantā  yassa vā pana vicikicchā anusayo appahīno tassa kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca appahīnā ati āmantā pe catukkamūlaka
translated: In three persons the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to conceit are abandoned.🔽In one in whom the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to views are unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to adhere to rules and observances unabandoned?🔽In one in whom the underlying tendency to adhere to rules and observances is unabandoned, are the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to views unabandoned?

original: Yassa kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā tassa bhavarāgānusayo …pe… avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā tassa bhava rāga anusayo pe avijjā anusayo appahīno ti āmantā
translated: In one in whom the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to adherence to rules and observances are unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to desire for being unabandoned? … Is the underlying tendency to ignorance unabandoned?

original: Yassa vā pana avijjānusayo appahīno tassa kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnāti?🔽Anāgāmissa avijjānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā, no ca tassa kāmarāgānusayo ca
analyzed: yassa vā pana avijjā anusayo appahīno tassa kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā ati  anāgāmissa avijjā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā no ca tassa kāma rāga anusayo ca
translated: Or, when someone has not abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance, has he not abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasures, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to doubt?

original: paṭighānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā. Dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ🔽avijjānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā, no ca🔽tesaṁ diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā. Puthujjanassa avijjānusayo ca
analyzed: paṭigha anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā dvinnam puggalāna  avijjā anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā no ca  tesam diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā puthujjanassa avijjā anusayo ca
translated: One who is a non-returner has not abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit, but he has abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasures, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to doubt.🔽Two kinds of persons have not abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasures, the underlying tendency to aversion, and the underlying tendency to conceit, but they have abandoned the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to doubt.

original: appahīno; kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo
analyzed: appahīno kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo
translated: An ordinary person has not abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance, but he has abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasures, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to doubt.

original: ca appahīnā. (Pañcakamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: ca appahīnā pañcakamūlaka
translated: (Fivefold.)

original: Yassa kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo ca appahīnā tassa avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo ca appahīnā tassa avijjā anusayo appahīno ti āmantā
translated: Is it the case that for one in whom the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to doubt, and the underlying tendency to desire for being are unabandoned, the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned?

original: Yassa vā pana avijjānusayo appahīno tassa kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo ca appahīnāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana avijjā anusayo appahīno tassa kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo ca appahīnā ati
translated: Or is it the case that for one in whom the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned, the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to doubt, and the underlying tendency to desire for being are unabandoned?

original: Anāgāmissa avijjānusayo ca mānānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo ca appahīnā, no ca tassa
analyzed: anāgāmissa avijjā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo ca appahīnā no ca tassa
translated: For a non-returner the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to conceit, and the underlying tendency to desire for being are unabandoned, but

original: kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā.
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā
translated: the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to doubt are abandoned.

original: Dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ avijjānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo
analyzed: dvinnam puggalānam avijjā anusayaḥ ca kāma rāga anusayaḥ ca paṭigha anusayaḥ ca māna anusayaḥ
translated: For two kinds of persons the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit,

original: ca bhavarāgānusayo ca appahīnā, no ca tesaṁ diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā.
analyzed: ca bhava rāga anusayo ca appahīnā no ca tesam diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā
translated: and the underlying tendency to desire for being are unabandoned, but the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to doubt are abandoned.

original: Puthujjanassa avijjānusayo ca appahīno, kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo
analyzed: puthujjanassa avijjā anusayo ca appahīno kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo
translated: In the case of an ordinary man, the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned, and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to resentment, the underlying tendency to conceit,

original: ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo ca appahīnā. (Chakkamūlakaṁ.)🔽7.2.5.5. Paṭilomaokāsa
analyzed: ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo ca appahīnā chakka mūlaka  paṭiloma okāsa
translated: the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to doubt, and the underlying tendency to lust for existence are unabandoned. (The six based on the root of ignorance.)🔽… the reverse order

original: Yattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīno tattha paṭighānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yattha kāma rāga anusayaḥ appahīno tattha paṭigha anusayaḥ appahīno ti
translated: “Where the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to resentment unabandoned there too?

original: Na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā.
analyzed: na vattabbaḥ pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā
translated: It can be said that it is unabandoned or abandoned.

original: Yattha vā pana paṭighānusayo appahīno tattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana paṭigha anusayaḥ appahīno tattha kāma rāga anusayaḥ appahīno ti
translated: “Where the underlying tendency to resentment is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires unabandoned there too?

original: Na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā.🔽Yattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīno tattha mānānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: na vattabbaḥ pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā  yattha kāma rāga anusayaḥ appahīno tattha māna anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: It can be said that it is unabandoned or abandoned.🔽“Where the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to conceit unabandoned there too?

original: Yattha vā pana mānānusayo appahīno tattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana māna anusayaḥ appahīno tattha kāma rāga anusayaḥ appahīno ti
translated: “Where the underlying tendency to conceit is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires unabandoned there too?

original: Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha mānānusayo appahīno; kāmarāgānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā ettha māna anusayaḥ appahīno kāma rāga anusayaḥ na vattabbo pahīnoti
translated: In the case of the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to conceit is unabandoned there, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires is abandoned or unabandoned.

original: vā “appahīno”ti vā. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu ettha mānānusayo ca appahīno kāmarāgānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: vā appahīno ti vā kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu ettha māna anusayo ca appahīno kāma rāga anusayo ca appahīno
translated: or “not abandoned.” In the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element, the underlying tendency to conceit is not abandoned and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires is not abandoned.

original: Yattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīno tattha diṭṭhānusayo …pe… vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha kāma rāga anusayo appahīno tattha diṭṭha anusayo pe vicikicchā anusayo appahīno ti āmantā
translated: Where the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires is not abandoned, is the underlying tendency to the false view of existence not abandoned there too?

original: Yattha vā pana vicikicchānusayo appahīno tattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana vicikicchā anusayo appahīno tattha kāma rāga anusayo appahīno ti
translated: Or where the underlying tendency to the false view of existence is not abandoned, is the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires not abandoned there too?🔽In painful feeling, in the element of form, and in the formless element, the underlying tendency to uncertainty is not abandoned, but

original: Dukkhāya vedanāya rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha vicikicchānusayo appahīno; kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā ettha vicikicchā anusayo appahīno kāma rāga anusayo
translated: the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires

original: na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu ettha vicikicchānusayo
analyzed: na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu ettha vicikicchā anusayo
translated: is not to be spoken of as either abandoned or not abandoned. In the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element, the underlying tendency to uncertainty

original: ca appahīno kāmarāgānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: ca appahīno kāma rāga anusayo ca appahīno
translated: is not abandoned and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires is not abandoned.

original: Yattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīno tattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yattha kāma rāga anusayaḥ appahīno tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ appahīno ti
translated: Where the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires is not abandoned, is the underlying tendency to lust for existence not abandoned there too?

original: Na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā.
analyzed: na vattabbaḥ pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā
translated: It is not to be spoken of as either abandoned or not abandoned.

original: Yattha vā pana bhavarāgānusayo appahīno tattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana bhava rāga anusayaḥ appahīno tattha kāma rāga anusayaḥ appahīno ti
translated: Or where the underlying tendency to lust for existence is not abandoned, is the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires not abandoned there too?

original: Na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā.
analyzed: na vattabbaḥ pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā
translated: He should not be spoken of as having abandoned or not abandoned.

original: Yattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīno tattha avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha kāma rāga anusayaḥ appahīno tattha avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: “Where the underlying tendency to lust is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to ignorance unabandoned there too?

original: Yattha vā pana avijjānusayo appahīno tattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno tattha kāmarāga anusayaḥ appahīno ti
translated: Or where the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to lust unabandoned there too?”

original: Dukkhāya vedanāya rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha avijjānusayo appahīno; kāmarāgānusayo🔽na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu ettha avijjānusayo
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā ettha avijjā anusayaḥ appahīnaḥ kāma rāga anusayo  na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu ettha avijjā anusayo
translated: In painful feeling and in the form and formless worlds the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned,🔽but the underlying tendency to lust should not be spoken of as either abandoned or unabandoned.

original: ca appahīno kāmarāgānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: ca appahīno kāma rāga anusayo ca appahīno
translated: In the sensual world and in two kinds of feeling the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned and the underlying tendency to lust is unabandoned.

original: Yattha paṭighānusayo appahīno tattha mānānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yattha paṭigha anusayaḥ appahīno tattha māna anusayaḥ appahīno ti
translated: “Where the underlying tendency to aversion is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to conceit unabandoned there too?

original: Na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā.
analyzed: na vattabbaḥ pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā
translated: He should not be spoken of as having abandoned or not abandoned.

original: Yattha vā pana mānānusayo appahīno tattha paṭighānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana māna anusayo appahīno tattha paṭigha anusayo appahīno ti
translated: Or where the underlying tendency to conceit is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to aversion unabandoned there too?

original: Na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā.
analyzed: na vattabbaḥ pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā
translated: He should not be spoken of as having abandoned or not abandoned.

original: Yattha paṭighānusayo appahīno tattha diṭṭhānusayo …pe… vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha paṭigha anusayo appahīno tattha diṭṭha anusayo pe vicikicchā anusayo appahīno ti āmantā
translated: Where the underlying tendency to resistance has not been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to false view … the underlying tendency to uncertainty … the underlying tendency to desire for being … the underlying tendency to ignorance not been abandoned?

original: Yattha vā pana vicikicchānusayo appahīno tattha paṭighānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana vicikicchā anusayo appahīno tattha paṭigha anusayo appahīno ti
translated: Or where the underlying tendency to ignorance has not been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to resistance not been abandoned?

original: Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha vicikicchānusayo appahīno;🔽paṭighānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Dukkhāya vedanāya ettha
analyzed: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha vicikicchā anusayo appahīno  paṭigha anusayaḥ na vattabbo pahīno ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā dukkhāya vedanāya ettha
translated: In the sense sphere and in two kinds of feeling in the fine-material and immaterial spheres the underlying tendency to ignorance has not been abandoned,🔽but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to resistance has been either abandoned or not abandoned.

original: vicikicchānusayo ca appahīno paṭighānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīno paṭigha anusayo ca appahīno
translated: In painful feeling the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to resistance have not been abandoned.

original: Yattha paṭighānusayo appahīno tattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yattha paṭigha anusayaḥ appahīno tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ appahīno ti
translated: Where the underlying tendency to resistance has not been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to ignorance not been abandoned?

original: Na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā.
analyzed: na vattabbaḥ pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā
translated: It cannot be said that it has been either abandoned or not abandoned.

original: Yattha vā pana bhavarāgānusayo appahīno tattha paṭighānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana bhava rāga anusayo appahīno tattha paṭigha anusayo appahīno ti
translated: Or where the underlying tendency to ignorance has not been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to resistance not been abandoned?

original: Na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā.🔽Yattha paṭighānusayo appahīno tattha avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: na vattabbaḥ pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā 🔽yattha paṭigha anusayaḥ appahīno tattha avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: It cannot be said that it has been either abandoned or not abandoned.

original: Yattha vā pana avijjānusayo appahīno tattha paṭighānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno tattha paṭigha anusayaḥ appahīno ti
translated: Or wherever the underlying tendency to ignorance has not been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to resistance not been abandoned there too?

original: Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha avijjānusayo appahīno;
analyzed: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno
translated: In the sense-desire element and in two of the feelings in the form element and in the formless element, the underlying tendency to ignorance has not been abandoned,

original: paṭighānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Dukkhāya vedanāya ettha
analyzed: paṭigha anusayaḥ na vattabbo pahīno ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā dukkhāya vedanāya ettha
translated: but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to resistance has been abandoned or not abandoned there. In painful feeling,

original: avijjānusayo ca appahīno paṭighānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: avijjā anusayo ca appahīno paṭigha anusayo ca appahīno
translated: the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to resistance have not been abandoned.

original: Yattha mānānusayo appahīno tattha diṭṭhānusayo …pe… vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha māna anusayo appahīno tattha diṭṭha anusayo pe vicikicchā anusayo appahīno ti āmantā
translated: Wherever the underlying tendency to conceit has not been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to false view … the underlying tendency to uncertainty not been abandoned there too?

original: Yattha vā pana vicikicchānusayo appahīno tattha mānānusayo appahīnoti?🔽Dukkhāya vedanāya ettha vicikicchānusayo appahīno; mānānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti
analyzed: yattha vā pana vicikicchā anusayaḥ appahīno tattha māna anusayaḥ appahīno ti  dukkhāya vedanāya ettha vicikicchā anusayaḥ appahīnaḥ māna anusayaḥ na vattabbo pahīnoti
translated: Or wherever the underlying tendency to uncertainty has not been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to conceit not been abandoned there too?🔽In painful feeling, the underlying tendency to uncertainty has not been abandoned,

original: vā “appahīno”ti vā. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha vicikicchānusayo
analyzed: vā appahīno ti vā kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha vicikicchā anusayo
translated: but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to conceit has been abandoned or not abandoned there. In the sense-desire element and in two of the feelings, in the form element and in the formless element, the underlying tendency to uncertainty

original: ca appahīno mānānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: ca appahīno māna anusayo ca appahīno
translated: and the underlying tendency to conceit have not been abandoned.

original: Yattha mānānusayo appahīno tattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīnoti?🔽Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu ettha mānānusayo appahīno; bhavarāgānusayo na vattabbo
analyzed: yattha māna anusayaḥ appahīno tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ appahīno ti  kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu ettha māna anusayaḥ appahīnaḥ bhava rāga anusayaḥ na vattabbo
translated: Where the underlying tendency to conceit has not been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to lust for being not been abandoned there?

original: “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha mānānusayo ca appahīno🔽bhavarāgānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: pahīnoti vā appahīnoti vā rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā ettha māna anusayo ca appahīno  bhava rāga anusayo ca appahīno
translated: In the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to conceit has not been abandoned, but it is not to be said that the underlying tendency to lust for being has been abandoned there or not abandoned there.

original: Yattha vā pana bhavarāgānusayo appahīno tattha mānānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana bhava rāga anusayaḥ appahīno tattha māna anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: Where the underlying tendency to lust for being has not been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to conceit not been abandoned there?

original: Yattha mānānusayo appahīno tattha avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha māna anusayaḥ appahīno tattha avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: Where the underlying tendency to conceit has not been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to ignorance not been abandoned there?

original: Yattha vā pana avijjānusayo appahīno tattha mānānusayo appahīnoti?🔽Dukkhāya vedanāya ettha avijjānusayo appahīno; mānānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti🔽vā “appahīno”ti vā. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha avijjānusayo
analyzed: yattha vā pana avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno tattha māna anusayaḥ appahīno ti  dukkhāya vedanāya ettha avijjā anusayaḥ appahīnaḥ māna anusayaḥ na vattabbaḥ pahīno ti  vā appahīno ti vā kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha avijjā anusayo
translated: Where the underlying tendency to ignorance has not been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to conceit not been abandoned there?🔽In painful feeling, the underlying tendency to ignorance has not been abandoned, but it is not to be said that the underlying tendency to conceit has been abandoned there or not abandoned there.

original: ca appahīno mānānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: ca appahīno māna anusayo ca appahīno
translated: In the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit have not been abandoned.

original: Yattha diṭṭhānusayo appahīno tattha vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.🔽Yattha vā pana vicikicchānusayo appahīno tattha diṭṭhānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā …pe….
analyzed: yattha diṭṭha anusayaḥ appahīno tattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā  yattha vā pana vicikicchā anusayo appahīno tattha diṭṭha anusayo appahīno ti āmantā pe
translated: “Where the underlying tendency to views is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to doubt unabandoned there too?”🔽“Where the underlying tendency to doubt is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to views unabandoned there too?”

original: Yattha vicikicchānusayo appahīno tattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīnoti?🔽Kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu ettha vicikicchānusayo appahīno; bhavarāgānusayo na vattabbo🔽“pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha vicikicchānusayo ca
analyzed: yattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ appahīno tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ appahīno ti  kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu ettha vicikicchā anusayaḥ appahīnaḥ bhava rāga anusayaḥ na vattabbo  pahīnoti vā appahīnoti vā rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā ettha vicikicchā anusayo ca
translated: “Where the underlying tendency to doubt is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to lust for existence unabandoned there too?”🔽In the sense-sphere element and in the three kinds of feeling, the underlying tendency to doubt is unabandoned there, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to lust for existence is either unabandoned or abandoned.

original: appahīno bhavarāgānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: appahīno bhava rāga anusayo ca appahīno
translated: In the fine-material and immaterial elements, the underlying tendency to doubt is unabandoned and the underlying tendency to lust for existence is unabandoned.

original: Yattha vā pana bhavarāgānusayo appahīno tattha vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.🔽Yattha vicikicchānusayo appahīno tattha avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana bhava rāga anusayaḥ appahīno tattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā  yattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ appahīno tattha avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: “Where the underlying tendency to lust for existence is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to doubt unabandoned there too?”🔽“Where the underlying tendency to doubt is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to ignorance unabandoned there too?”

original: Yattha vā pana avijjānusayo appahīno tattha vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno tattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: “Where the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to doubt unabandoned there too?”

original: Yattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīno tattha avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ appahīno tattha avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: “Where the underlying tendency to craving for being is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to ignorance unabandoned there?”

original: Yattha vā pana avijjānusayo appahīno tattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīnoti?🔽Kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu ettha avijjānusayo appahīno; bhavarāgānusayo na vattabbo
analyzed: yattha vā pana avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno tattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ appahīno ti  kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu ettha avijjā anusayaḥ appahīnaḥ bhava rāga anusayaḥ na vattabbo
translated: “Or where the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to craving for being unabandoned there?”🔽In the sense-sphere element and in the three kinds of feeling, the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to craving for being is unabandoned there or abandoned there.

original: “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha avijjānusayo ca appahīno🔽bhavarāgānusayo ca appahīno. (Ekamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā tattha mānānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.🔽Yattha vā pana mānānusayo appahīno tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnāti?
analyzed: pahīno ti vā appahīno ti vā rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā ettha avijjā anusayo ca appahīno  bhava rāga anusayo ca appahīno eka mūlaka  yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā tattha māna anusayo appahīno ti natthi  yattha vā pana māna anusayo appahīno tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā ati
translated: In the fine-material and immaterial elements, the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned and the underlying tendency to craving for being is unabandoned.🔽“Where the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion are unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to conceit unabandoned there?”🔽“Or where the underlying tendency to conceit is unabandoned, are the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion unabandoned there?”

original: Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha mānānusayo appahīno; kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā ettha māna anusayo appahīno kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo
translated: In the fine-material and immaterial elements, the underlying tendency to conceit is unabandoned, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion are unabandoned there or abandoned there.

original: ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu ettha mānānusayo
analyzed: ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu ettha māna anusayo
translated: as to whether the underlying tendency to conceit has been abandoned or not abandoned.

original: ca kāmarāgānusayo ca appahīnā; paṭighānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā.
analyzed: ca kāma rāga anusayo ca appahīnā paṭigha anusayo na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā
translated: In the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element, the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires have been abandoned, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to resistance has been abandoned or not abandoned.

original: Yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā tattha diṭṭhānusayo …pe… vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā tattha diṭṭha anusayo pe vicikicchā anusayo appahīno ti natthi
translated: Where the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resistance have been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to views … the underlying tendency to uncertainty been abandoned there too? There is none.

original: Yattha vā pana vicikicchānusayo appahīno tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnāti?🔽Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha vicikicchānusayo appahīno; kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo🔽ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu ettha vicikicchānusayo
analyzed: yattha vā pana vicikicchā anusayo appahīno tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā ati  rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā ettha vicikicchā anusayo appahīno kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo  ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu ettha vicikicchā anusayo
translated: Or where the underlying tendency to uncertainty has been abandoned, have the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resistance been abandoned there too?🔽In the fine-material and immaterial elements, the underlying tendency to uncertainty has been abandoned, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resistance have been abandoned or not abandoned.

original: ca kāmarāgānusayo ca appahīnā; paṭighānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti
analyzed: ca kāma rāga anusayo ca appahīnā paṭigha anusayo na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti
translated: In the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element, the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires have been abandoned, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to resistance has been abandoned or not abandoned.

original: vā. Dukkhāya vedanāya ettha vicikicchānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: vā dukkhāya vedanāya ettha vicikicchā anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo
translated: In painful feeling, the inherent tendency to uncertainty and the inherent tendency to repulsion are unabandoned, but the inherent tendency to lust for sensual desires

original: na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā.
analyzed: na vattabbaḥ pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā
translated: is not described as either abandoned or unabandoned.

original: Yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā tattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā tattha bhava rāga anusayo appahīno ti natthi
translated: Where the inherent tendency to lust for sensual desires and the inherent tendency to repulsion are unabandoned, is the inherent tendency to lust for being unabandoned there? There is none.

original: Yattha vā pana bhavarāgānusayo appahīno tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnāti? Na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā.
analyzed: yattha vā pana bhava rāga anusayo appahīno tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā ati na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā
translated: Or where the inherent tendency to lust for being is unabandoned, are the inherent tendency to lust for sensual desires and the inherent tendency to repulsion unabandoned there? They are not described as either abandoned or unabandoned.

original: Yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā tattha avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā tattha avijjā anusayo appahīno ti natthi
translated: Where the inherent tendency to lust for sensual desires and the inherent tendency to repulsion are unabandoned, is the inherent tendency to ignorance unabandoned there? There is none.

original: Yattha vā pana avijjānusayo appahīno tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnāti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana avijjā anusayo appahīno tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā ati
translated: Or where the inherent tendency to ignorance is unabandoned, are the inherent tendency to lust for sensual desires and the inherent tendency to repulsion unabandoned there?

original: Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha avijjānusayo appahīno; kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā ettha avijjā anusayo appahīno kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo
translated: In the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the inherent tendency to ignorance is unabandoned, but the inherent tendency to lust for sensual desires and the inherent tendency to repulsion

original: ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu ettha avijjānusayo🔽ca kāmarāgānusayo ca appahīnā; paṭighānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti
analyzed: ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu ettha avijjā anusayo  ca kāma rāga anusayo ca appahīnā paṭigha anusayo na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti
translated: as to whether they are abandoned or not abandoned. In the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element, ignorance-proclivity

original: vā. Dukkhāya vedanāya ettha avijjānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: vā dukkhāya vedanāya ettha avijjā anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo
translated: and sensual-desire-proclivity are not abandoned, but hostility-proclivity is not to be spoken of as either abandoned or not abandoned. In painful feeling, ignorance-proclivity and hostility-proclivity are not abandoned, but sensual-desire-proclivity

original: na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. (Dukamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā tattha diṭṭhānusayo …pe… vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.🔽Yattha vā pana vicikicchānusayo appahīno tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnāti?
analyzed: na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā duka mūlaka  yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā tattha diṭṭha anusayo pe vicikicchā anusayo appahīno ti natthi  yattha vā pana vicikicchā anusayo appahīno tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā ati
translated: is not to be spoken of as either abandoned or not abandoned. (The root-causelessness in the case of the painful feeling.)🔽Where sensual-desire-proclivity and hostility-proclivity and conceit-proclivity are not abandoned, are wrong-view-proclivity and uncertainty-proclivity not abandoned there too? There is none.🔽Where uncertainty-proclivity is not abandoned, are sensual-desire-proclivity and hostility-proclivity and conceit-proclivity not abandoned there too?

original: Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha vicikicchānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā ettha vicikicchā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo
translated: In the fine-material and immaterial elements, uncertainty-proclivity and conceit-proclivity are not abandoned, but sensual-desire-proclivity

original: ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu
analyzed: ca paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā kāmadhātuyā dvīsu
translated: and the underlying tendency to resistance should not be said to be either abandoned or unabandoned.

original: vedanāsu ettha vicikicchānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā; paṭighānusayo
analyzed: vedanāsu ettha vicikicchā anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā paṭigha anusayo
translated: In the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere here the underlying tendency to uncertainty, the underlying tendency to lust for existence, and the underlying tendency to conceit are unabandoned;🔽the underlying tendency to resistance should not be said to be either abandoned or unabandoned.

original: na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Dukkhāya vedanāya ettha vicikicchānusayo
analyzed: na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā dukkhāya vedanāya ettha vicikicchā anusayo
translated: In painful feeling here the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to resistance are unabandoned;

original: ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā.🔽Yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā tattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā  yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā tattha bhava rāga anusayo appahīno ti natthi
translated: the underlying tendency to lust for existence and the underlying tendency to conceit should not be said to be either abandoned or unabandoned.🔽“Where the underlying tendency to lust for sense desires, the underlying tendency to resistance, and the underlying tendency to conceit are unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to lust for existence unabandoned there too?

original: Yattha vā pana bhavarāgānusayo appahīno tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnāti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana bhava rāga anusayo appahīno tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā ati
translated: “Or where the underlying tendency to lust for existence is unabandoned, are the underlying tendency to lust for sense desires, the underlying tendency to resistance, and the underlying tendency to conceit unabandoned there too?

original: Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha bhavarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā.
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā ettha bhava rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā
translated: In the fine-material and immaterial dhammas there is the underlying tendency to lust for existence and the underlying tendency to conceit that have not been abandoned, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment have been abandoned or not abandoned.

original: Yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā tattha avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā tattha avijjā anusayo appahīno ti natthi
translated: Where the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to resentment, and the underlying tendency to conceit have not been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to ignorance not been abandoned there too? There is none.

original: Yattha vā pana avijjānusayo appahīno tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnāti?🔽Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha avijjānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo🔽ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu
analyzed: yattha vā pana avijjā anusayo appahīno tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā ati  rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā ettha avijjā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo  ca paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā kāmadhātuyā dvīsu
translated: Or where the underlying tendency to ignorance has not been abandoned, have the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to resentment, and the underlying tendency to conceit not been abandoned there too?🔽In the fine-material and immaterial dhammas there is the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit that have not been abandoned, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment have been abandoned or not abandoned.

original: vedanāsu ettha avijjānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā; paṭighānusayo
