analyzed: vedanāsu ettha avijjā anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā paṭigha anusayo
translated: In the two kinds of feeling in the sensual realm there is the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, and the underlying tendency to conceit that have not been abandoned, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to resentment has been abandoned or not abandoned.

original: na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Dukkhāya vedanāya ettha avijjānusayo ca
analyzed: na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā dukkhāya vedanāya ettha avijjā anusayo ca
translated: In painful feeling there is the underlying tendency to ignorance that has not been abandoned, and it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to resentment, and the underlying tendency to conceit have been abandoned or not abandoned.

original: paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti
analyzed: paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati
translated: and the underlying tendency to resistance has not been abandoned,🔽and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasures and the underlying tendency to conceit have not been abandoned.

original: vā “appahīnā”ti vā. (Tikamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: vā vā
translated: and the underlying tendency to resistance has not been abandoned, then the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to conceit have either been abandoned or have not been abandoned.🔽(The triad with the three roots.)

original: Yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca appahīnā tattha vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca appahīnā tattha vicikicchā anusayo appahīno ti natthi
translated: Where the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to resistance, and the underlying tendency to conceit have not been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to false view not been abandoned there? There is none.

original: Yattha vā pana vicikicchānusayo appahīno tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca appahīnāti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana vicikicchā anusayo appahīno tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca appahīnā ati
translated: Or again, where the underlying tendency to false view has not been abandoned, have the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to resistance, and the underlying tendency to conceit not been abandoned there?

original: Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha vicikicchānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā ettha vicikicchā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca
translated: In the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to false view have not been abandoned,

original: appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti
analyzed: appahīnā kāma rāga anusayaḥ ca paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati
translated: but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resistance have either been abandoned or have not been abandoned.

original: vā. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu ettha vicikicchānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo
analyzed: vā kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu ettha vicikicchā anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo
translated: In the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to conceit, and the underlying tendency to false view have not been abandoned,

original: ca diṭṭhānusayo ca appahīnā; paṭighānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti
analyzed: ca diṭṭha anusayo ca appahīnā paṭigha anusayo na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti
translated: but the underlying tendency to resistance has either been abandoned or has not been abandoned.

original: vā. Dukkhāya vedanāya ettha vicikicchānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca
analyzed: vā dukkhāya vedanāya ettha vicikicchā anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca
translated: In painful feeling, the underlying tendency to uncertainty, the underlying tendency to repulsion, and the underlying tendency to views🔽

original: appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti
analyzed: appahīnā kāma rāga anusayaḥ ca māna anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati
translated: In painful feeling, the inherent tendencies of uncertainty, resentment, and false view are unabandoned, while those of lust and conceit are either unabandoned or abandoned. …

original: vā …pe…. (Catukkamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā tattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.🔽Yattha vā pana bhavarāgānusayo appahīno tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnāti?
analyzed: vā pe  yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā tattha bhava rāga anusayo appahīno ti natthi  yattha vā pana bhava rāga anusayo appahīno tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā ati
translated: (The fourfold section is to be expanded in the same way as above.)🔽Where the inherent tendencies of lust, resentment, conceit, false view, and uncertainty are unabandoned, is the inherent tendency to craving for becoming unabandoned there? There is none.🔽Or where the inherent tendency to craving for becoming is unabandoned, are the inherent tendencies of lust, resentment, conceit, false view, and uncertainty unabandoned there?

original: Mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā.
analyzed: māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā
translated: In the case of the inherent tendencies of conceit, false view, and uncertainty, the inherent tendencies of lust and resentment are either unabandoned or abandoned.

original: Yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā tattha avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā tattha avijjā anusayo appahīno ti natthi
translated: Where the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty have not been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to ignorance not been abandoned there? There is none.

original: Yattha vā pana avijjānusayo appahīno tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnāti?🔽Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha avijjānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo
analyzed: yattha vā pana avijjā anusayo appahīno tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā ati  rūpa dhātuyāḥ arūpa dhātuyāḥ ettha avijjā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo
translated: Or where the underlying tendency to ignorance has not been abandoned, have the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty not been abandoned there?

original: ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti🔽vā. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu ettha avijjānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo
analyzed: ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayaḥ ca paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati  vā kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu ettha avijjā anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo
translated: In the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty have not been abandoned, but the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion have not been abandoned.

original: ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā; paṭighānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti
analyzed: ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā paṭigha anusayo na vattabbo pahīno ti
translated: In the sense-sphere dhammas, the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty have not been abandoned, but the underlying tendency to aversion has not been abandoned.

original: vā “appahīno”ti vā. Dukkhāya vedanāya ettha avijjānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo
analyzed: vā appahīno ti vā dukkhāya vedanāya ettha avijjā anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo
translated: … “not abandoned.” As to painful feeling, here the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to resentment, and the underlying tendency to views,

original: ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti
analyzed: ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati
translated: and the underlying tendency to uncertainty are unabandoned, while the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to conceit are either unabandoned or abandoned.

original: vā “appahīnā”ti vā. (Pañcakamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo ca appahīnā tattha avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: vā vā  yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo ca appahīnā tattha avijjā anusayo appahīno ti natthi
translated: (Fivefold)🔽As to the question ‘Where the underlying tendency to lust … the underlying tendency to resentment … the underlying tendency to conceit … the underlying tendency to views … the underlying tendency to uncertainty … the underlying tendency to desire for being is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to ignorance unabandoned there? ‘ the answer is: No.

original: Yattha vā pana avijjānusayo appahīno tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo ca appahīnāti?
analyzed: yattha vā pana avijjā anusayo appahīno tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo ca appahīnā ati
translated: As to the question ‘Where the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned, are the underlying tendency to lust … the underlying tendency to resentment … the underlying tendency to conceit … the underlying tendency to views … the underlying tendency to uncertainty … the underlying tendency to desire for being unabandoned there? ‘

original: Rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā ettha avijjānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyāḥ arūpa dhātuyāḥ ettha avijjā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo
translated: the answer is: In the case of the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, here the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views,🔽and the underlying tendency to uncertainty

original: ca bhavarāgānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti🔽vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu ettha avijjānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: ca bhava rāga anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati  vā vā kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu ettha avijjā anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo
translated: and the underlying tendency to lust for being is unabandoned, then the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to aversion are not to be spoken of as either unabandoned or abandoned.

original: ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā; paṭighānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo🔽ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Dukkhāya vedanāya ettha avijjānusayo
analyzed: ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā paṭigha anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo  ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā dukkhāya vedanāya ettha avijjā anusayo
translated: In the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element, the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty are unabandoned;🔽but the underlying tendency to aversion and the underlying tendency to lust for being are not to be spoken of as either unabandoned or abandoned.

original: ca paṭighānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: ca paṭigha anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo
translated: In painful feeling, the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty are unabandoned;

original: ca mānānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. (Chakkamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: ca māna anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā
translated: but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to conceit, and the underlying tendency to lust for being are not to be spoken of as either unabandoned or abandoned.

original: 7.2.5.6. Paṭilomapuggalokāsa
analyzed: paṭiloma puggala ukāsa
translated: .... The reverse order of the person and the base

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīno tassa tattha paṭighānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo appahīno tassa tattha paṭigha anusayo appahīno ti
translated: When someone has unabandoned the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires in a certain place, has he unabandoned the underlying tendency to aversion there too?

original: Na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā.
analyzed: na vattabbaḥ pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā
translated: It should not be said that he has unabandoned it or that he has abandoned it.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha paṭighānusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha paṭigha anusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo appahīno ti
translated: Or, where the underlying tendency to resistance has not been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to lust not been abandoned there?

original: Na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā.
analyzed: na vattabbaḥ pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā
translated: It cannot be said that it has been abandoned or that it has not been abandoned.

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīno tassa tattha mānānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayaḥ appahīno tassa tattha māna anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: Where the underlying tendency to lust has not been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to conceit not been abandoned there?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha mānānusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha māna anusayaḥ appahīno tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayaḥ appahīno ti
translated: Or, where the underlying tendency to conceit has not been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to lust not been abandoned there?

original: Anāgāmissa rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha mānānusayo appahīno; kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: anāgāmissa rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha māna anusayo appahīno kāma rāga anusayo
translated: In the case of a non-returner in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to conceit has not been abandoned there, but🔽it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to lust has been abandoned there or that it has not been abandoned there.

original: na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu
analyzed: na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā tassa iva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu
translated: In the case of that same person in the sense-sphere element and in two of the feelings,

original: tassa tattha mānānusayo appahīno, no ca tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīno. Tiṇṇaṁ
analyzed: tassa tattha māna anusayaḥ appahīno no ca tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayaḥ appahīno
translated: the underlying tendency to conceit has not been abandoned there, but the underlying tendency to lust has not been abandoned there.

original: puggalānaṁ rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tesaṁ tattha mānānusayo appahīno; kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: puggalānam rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tesam tattha māna anusayo appahīno kāma rāga anusayo
translated: In the case of three persons in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to conceit has not been abandoned there, but🔽the underlying tendency to lust has not been abandoned there.

original: na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu
analyzed: na vattabbaḥ pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā tesam eva puggalānam kāmadhātuyā dvīsu
translated: He should not be called one in whom it is abandoned or one in whom it is not abandoned.

original: vedanāsu tesaṁ tattha mānānusayo ca appahīno kāmarāgānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: vedanāsu tesam tattha māna anusayo ca appahīno kāma rāga anusayo ca appahīno
translated: In the case of these same three persons in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, their underlying tendency to conceit is unabandoned and their underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires is unabandoned.

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīno tassa tattha diṭṭhānusayo …pe… vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo appahīno tassa tattha diṭṭha anusayo pe vicikicchā anusayo appahīno ti
translated: In the case of those who have an unabandoned underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, has their underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and their underlying tendency to conceit been abandoned?

original: Dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tesaṁ tattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīno,
analyzed: dvinnam puggalānam kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tesam tattha kāma rāga anusayo appahīno
translated: In the case of two persons in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, their underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires is unabandoned,🔽but their underlying tendency to scepticism is abandoned.

original: no ca tesaṁ tattha vicikicchānusayo appahīno. Puthujjanassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu
analyzed: no ca tesam tattha vicikicchā anusayo appahīno puthujjanassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu
translated: In the case of an ordinary man in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere,

original: tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca appahīno vicikicchānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca appahīno vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīno
translated: his underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and his underlying tendency to scepticism are unabandoned.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchānusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchā anusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo appahīno ti
translated: In the case of those who have an unabandoned underlying tendency to scepticism, has their underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires been abandoned?

original: Puthujjanassa dukkhāya vedanāya rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo
analyzed: puthujjanassa dukkhāya vedanāya rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo
translated: In the case of an ordinary man in painful feeling, in the fine-material and immaterial kinds of becoming, his underlying tendency to scepticism

original: appahīno; kāmarāgānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa
analyzed: appahīnaḥ kāma rāga anusayaḥ na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā tassa iva puggalassa
translated: the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires has either been abandoned or has not been abandoned.🔽In the case of that person,

original: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo ca appahīno kāmarāgānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīno kāma rāga anusayo ca appahīno
translated: in the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element, the underlying tendency to uncertainty has been abandoned, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires has not been abandoned.

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīno tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo appahīno tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayo appahīno ti
translated: “When anyone’s underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires has not been abandoned, has his underlying tendency to lust for existence not been abandoned?

original: Na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā.
analyzed: na vattabbaḥ pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā
translated: It cannot be said that it has been abandoned or that it has not been abandoned.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha bhava rāga anusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo appahīno ti
translated: Or when anyone’s underlying tendency to lust for existence has not been abandoned, has his underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires not been abandoned?

original: Na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā.
analyzed: na vattabbaḥ pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā
translated: It cannot be said that it has been abandoned or that it has not been abandoned.

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīno tassa tattha avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayaḥ appahīno tassa tattha avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: “When anyone’s underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires has not been abandoned, has his underlying tendency to ignorance not been abandoned?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha avijjānusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno tassa tattha kāmarāga anusayaḥ appahīno ti
translated: Or when anyone’s underlying tendency to ignorance has not been abandoned, has his underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires not been abandoned?

original: Anāgāmissa dukkhāya vedanāya rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha avijjānusayo appahīno;

original: Yassa yattha paṭighānusayo appahīno tassa tattha diṭṭhānusayo …pe… vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti?🔽Dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ dukkhāya vedanāya tesaṁ tattha paṭighānusayo appahīno, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: yassa yattha paṭigha anusayo appahīno tassa tattha diṭṭha anusayo pe vicikicchā anusayo appahīno ti  dvinnam puggalānam dukkhāya vedanāya tesam tattha paṭigha anusayo appahīno no ca tesam
translated: In regard to which ever of the five kinds of objects of sensual pleasure a person has not abandoned the underlying tendency to resistance, has he not abandoned the underlying tendency to false view … the underlying tendency to conceit … the underlying tendency to lust … the underlying tendency to aversion … the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to that object?🔽In regard to painful feeling, the underlying tendency to resistance has been abandoned by two persons, but the underlying tendency to uncertainty has not been abandoned by them.

original: tattha vicikicchānusayo appahīno. Puthujjanassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha paṭighānusayo🔽ca appahīno vicikicchānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: tattha vicikicchā anusayo appahīno puthujjanassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha paṭigha anusayo  ca appahīnaḥ vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīno
translated: In regard to painful feeling, the underlying tendency to resistance has been abandoned by the worldling, but the underlying tendency to uncertainty has not been abandoned by him.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchānusayo appahīno tassa tattha paṭighānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchā anusayo appahīno tassa tattha paṭigha anusayo appahīno ti
translated: In regard to which ever of the five kinds of objects of sensual pleasure a person has not abandoned the underlying tendency to uncertainty, has he not abandoned the underlying tendency to resistance in regard to that object?

original: Puthujjanassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo🔽appahīno; paṭighānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa
analyzed: puthujjanassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo  appahīnaḥ paṭigha anusayaḥ na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā tassa iva puggalassa
translated: In the world of sensual pleasure and in two kinds of feeling in the world of form and in the formless world, the underlying tendency to uncertainty has been abandoned by the worldling, but the underlying tendency to resistance has not been abandoned by him.

original: dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo ca appahīno paṭighānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīno paṭigha anusayo ca appahīno
translated: In regard to painful feeling, the underlying tendency to uncertainty has been abandoned by the worldling, but the underlying tendency to resistance has not been abandoned by him.

original: Yassa yattha paṭighānusayo appahīno tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa yattha paṭigha anusayo appahīno tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayo appahīno ti
translated: Has he who has not abandoned the underlying tendency to resistance in regard to any given state not abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for becoming in regard to that state?

original: Na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā.
analyzed: na vattabbaḥ pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā
translated: It cannot be said that he has abandoned it or that he has not abandoned it.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīno tassa tattha paṭighānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha bhava rāga anusayo appahīno tassa tattha paṭigha anusayo appahīno ti
translated: Or has he who has not abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for becoming in regard to any given state not abandoned the underlying tendency to resistance in regard to that state?

original: Na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā.
analyzed: na vattabbaḥ pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā
translated: It cannot be said that he has abandoned it or that he has not abandoned it.

original: Yassa yattha paṭighānusayo appahīno tassa tattha avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: yassa yattha paṭigha anusayaḥ appahīno tassa tattha avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: Has he who has not abandoned the underlying tendency to resistance in regard to any given state not abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to that state?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha avijjānusayo appahīno tassa tattha paṭighānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha avijjā anusayo appahīno tassa tattha paṭigha anusayo appahīno ti
translated: Or has he who has not abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to any given state not abandoned the underlying tendency to resistance in regard to that state?

original: Anāgāmissa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha avijjānusayo
analyzed: anāgāmissa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha avijjā anusayo
translated: One who is a non-returner has not abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere and in the fine-material sphere, and in the immaterial sphere.

original: appahīno; paṭighānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa
analyzed: appahīnaḥ paṭigha anusayaḥ na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā tassa iva puggalassa
translated: It cannot be said that he has abandoned or has not abandoned the underlying tendency to resistance in regard to that.

original: dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha avijjānusayo appahīno, no ca tassa tattha paṭighānusayo
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha avijjā anusayo appahīnaḥ no ca tassa tattha paṭigha anusayo
translated: But in painful feeling he has not abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to that, but it cannot be said that he has abandoned or has not abandoned the underlying tendency to resistance in regard to that.

original: appahīno. Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tesaṁ🔽tattha avijjānusayo appahīno; paṭighānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti

translated: in the case of three persons, it has not yet been abandoned.🔽In the case of these three persons, the underlying tendency to ignorance has not yet been abandoned in regard to the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element and in the material and immaterial elements, but the underlying tendency to repugnance has either been abandoned or has not yet been abandoned.

original: vā. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ dukkhāya vedanāya tesaṁ tattha avijjānusayo ca appahīno🔽paṭighānusayo ca appahīno.

original: Yassa yattha mānānusayo appahīno tassa tattha diṭṭhānusayo …pe… vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti?🔽Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tesaṁ tattha
analyzed: yassa yattha māna anusayo appahīno tassa tattha diṭṭha anusayo pe vicikicchā anusayo appahīno ti  tiṇṇam puggalānam kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tesam tattha

analyzed: māna anusayaḥ appahīno no ca tesam tattha vicikicchā anusayaḥ appahīno puthujjanassa  kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha māna anusayo ca appahīno
translated: In the case of three persons, the underlying tendency to conceit has not yet been abandoned in regard to the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element and in the material and immaterial elements, but their underlying tendency to uncertainty has either been abandoned or has not yet been abandoned. In the case of an ordinary man,

original: vicikicchānusayo ca appahīno.
analyzed: vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīno

analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchā anusayo appahīno tassa tattha māna anusayo appahīno ti

analyzed: na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā tassa iva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu

analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha avijjā anusayo appahīno tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo appahīno ti

analyzed: tiṇṇam puggalānam kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tesam tattha
