analyzed: avijjā anusayo appahīno no ca tesam tattha vicikicchā anusayo appahīno puthujjanassa
translated: the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned in them but the underlying tendency to uncertainty is abandoned in them. In the case of an ordinary man,

original: kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha avijjānusayo ca appahīno
analyzed: kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha avijjā anusayo ca appahīno
translated: in the sense-desire element and in three kinds of feeling, in the fine-material element and in the immaterial element, the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned in him and

original: vicikicchānusayo ca appahīno.🔽Yassa yattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīno tassa tattha avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Āmantā.
analyzed: vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīno  yassa yattha bhava rāga anusayaḥ appahīno tassa tattha avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno ti āmantā
translated: the underlying tendency to uncertainty is unabandoned in him.🔽Is the underlying tendency to lust for being in any given case the underlying tendency to ignorance?

original: Yassa vā pana yattha avijjānusayo appahīno tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīnoti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha avijjā anusayo appahīno tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayo appahīno ti
translated: Or is the underlying tendency to ignorance in any given case the underlying tendency to lust for being?

original: Catunnaṁ puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu tesaṁ tattha avijjānusayo appahīno;
analyzed: catunnam puggalānam kāmadhātuyā tīsu vedanāsu tesam tattha avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno
translated: As to the four persons, in the case of the three kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element their underlying-tendency to ignorance is unabandoned,

original: bhavarāgānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ rūpadhātuyā
analyzed: bhava rāga anusayaḥ na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā tesaṃ eva puggalānam rūpadhātuyā
translated: but their underlying-tendency to lust for being is not to be spoken of as either abandoned or unabandoned. In the case of the three kinds of feeling in the fine-material element

original: arūpadhātuyā tesaṁ tattha avijjānusayo ca appahīno bhavarāgānusayo ca appahīno. (Ekamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha mānānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: arūpa dhātuyā tesam tattha avijjā anusayo ca appahīno bhava rāga anusayo ca appahīno eka mūlaka  yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha māna anusayo appahīno ti natthi
translated: and in the immaterial element their underlying-tendency to ignorance and their underlying-tendency to lust for being are unabandoned. (One root.)🔽As to “In the case of anyone in whom the underlying tendency to lust is unabandoned the underlying tendency to conceit is unabandoned too”, there is none.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha mānānusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha māna anusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā ati
translated: As to “In the case of anyone in whom the underlying tendency to conceit is unabandoned the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion are unabandoned too”,

original: Anāgāmissa rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha mānānusayo appahīno; kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: anāgāmissa rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha māna anusayo appahīno kāma rāga anusayo
translated: in the case of the non-returner in the fine-material and immaterial elements his underlying tendency to conceit is unabandoned,

original: ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa
analyzed: ca paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā tassa iva puggalassa
translated: but his underlying tendency to lust and his underlying tendency to aversion are not to be spoken of as either abandoned or unabandoned. In the case of the same person🔽in the sense-desire element and in the fine-material element his underlying tendency to conceit is unabandoned,

original: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha mānānusayo appahīno, no ca tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha māna anusayo appahīno no ca tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo
translated: In the case of the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element, the underlying tendency to conceit is unabandoned there, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires

original: appahīno; paṭighānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ
analyzed: appahīnaḥ paṭigha anusayo na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā tiṇṇam puggalāna
translated: is not unabandoned there. The underlying tendency to resentment is not described as either unabandoned or abandoned.🔽In the case of the three kinds of persons

original: rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tesaṁ tattha mānānusayo appahīno; kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo🔽ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu
analyzed: rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tesam tattha māna anusayo appahīno kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo  ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā tesam eva puggalānam kāmadhātuyā dvīsu
translated: in the fine-material and immaterial elements, the underlying tendency to conceit is unabandoned there, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment

original: vedanāsu tesaṁ tattha mānānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo ca appahīnā; paṭighānusayo na
analyzed: vedanāsu tesam tattha māna anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo ca appahīnā paṭigha anusayo na
translated: are not described as either unabandoned or abandoned. In the case of the two kinds of feeling in the sense-desire element of those same three kinds of persons, the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires are unabandoned there, but the underlying tendency to resentment

original: vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā.
analyzed: vattabbaḥ pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā
translated: is not described as either unabandoned or abandoned.

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha diṭṭhānusayo …pe… vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha diṭṭha anusayo pe vicikicchā anusayo appahīno ti natthi
translated: In the case of those whose underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and whose underlying tendency to resentment are unabandoned, is their underlying tendency to the view of becoming unabandoned there? … Is their underlying tendency to uncertainty …

original: Yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchānusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnāti?🔽Puthujjanassa rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo appahīno; kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchā anusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā ati  puthujjanassa rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo appahīnaḥ kāma rāga anusayo
translated: Or, where the underlying tendency to uncertainty is unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires unabandoned there?

original: ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa
analyzed: ca paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā tassa iva puggalassa
translated: In an ordinary man in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to uncertainty is unabandoned there, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment are unabandoned there or abandoned there.

original: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo ca appahīnā;
analyzed: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo ca appahīnā
translated: In an ordinary man in the sense-desire element and in two kinds of feeling, the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires are unabandoned there,

original: paṭighānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa dukkhāya
analyzed: paṭigha anusayaḥ na vattabbo pahīno ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā tassa iva puggalassa dukkhāya
translated: but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to resentment is unabandoned there or abandoned there. In an ordinary man in painful feeling,

original: vedanāya tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: vedanāya tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo
translated: the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to resentment are unabandoned there,

original: na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā.
analyzed: na vattabbaḥ pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā
translated: but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires is unabandoned there or abandoned there.

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayo appahīno ti natthi
translated: Where the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment are unabandoned, is the underlying tendency to lust for existence unabandoned there? There is none.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha bhava rāga anusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā ati
translated: Or, where the underlying tendency to craving for existence has not been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment not been abandoned there?

original: Na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā.
analyzed: na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā
translated: It cannot be said that they have been abandoned or that they have not been abandoned there.

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.🔽Yassa vā pana yattha avijjānusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnāti?
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha avijjā anusayo appahīno ti natthi  yassa vā pana yattha avijjā anusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā ati
translated: Where the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment have not been abandoned, has the underlying tendency to ignorance not been abandoned there? There is none.🔽Or, where the underlying tendency to ignorance has not been abandoned, have the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment not been abandoned there?

original: Anāgāmissa rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha avijjānusayo appahīno; kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: anāgāmissa rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha avijjā anusayo appahīnaḥ kāma rāga anusayo
translated: In the case of a non-returner, where the underlying tendency to ignorance has not been abandoned in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, have the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment not been abandoned there?

original: ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa
analyzed: ca paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā tassa iva puggalassa
translated: It cannot be said that they have been abandoned or that they have not been abandoned there.

original: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha avijjānusayo appahīno, no ca tassa tattha
analyzed: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha avijjā anusayo appahīno no ca tassa tattha
translated: In the case of that same person, where the underlying tendency to ignorance has not been abandoned in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, has the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires not been abandoned there?

original: kāmarāgānusayo appahīno. Paṭighānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā.
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayaḥ appahīnaḥ paṭigha anusayaḥ na vattabbo pahīnaḥ iti vā appahīnaḥ iti vā
translated: It has not been abandoned there, but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to resentment has been abandoned there or that it has not been abandoned there.🔽In the case of that same person, where the underlying tendency to ignorance has not been abandoned in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, has the underlying tendency to resentment not been abandoned there?

original: Tasseva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha avijjānusayo appahīno, no ca tassa
analyzed: tassa iva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha avijjā anusayaḥ appahīno no ca tassa
translated: In the case of the person who has not abandoned the fetter of lust for sensual pleasures in the sensual realm, the fetter of aversion in the sensual realm has been abandoned, but the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to that has not been abandoned.

original: tattha paṭighānusayo appahīno; kāmarāgānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti
analyzed: tattha paṭigha anusayaḥ appahīnaḥ kāma rāga anusayaḥ na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti
translated: The underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasures in regard to that should not be said to have been abandoned or not to have been abandoned.

original: vā. Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tesaṁ tattha avijjānusayo appahīno;
analyzed: vā tiṇṇam puggalānam rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tesam tattha avijjā anusayo appahīno
translated: In the case of the three persons in the fine-material and immaterial realms, the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to that has not been abandoned.

original: kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tesaññeva
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayaḥ ca paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā tesañca eva
translated: The underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasures and the underlying tendency to aversion in regard to that should not be said to have been abandoned or not to have been abandoned.

original: puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tesaṁ tattha avijjānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: puggalānam kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tesam tattha avijjā anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo
translated: In the case of those same three persons in the sensual realm and in two kinds of feeling, the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to that and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasures in regard to that have not been abandoned.

original: ca appahīnā; paṭighānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ🔽dukkhāya vedanāya tesaṁ tattha avijjānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: ca appahīnā paṭigha anusayo na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā tesaṃ eva puggalāna  dukkhāya vedanāya tesam tattha avijjā anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo
translated: The underlying tendency to aversion in regard to that should not be said to have been abandoned or not to have been abandoned. In the case of those same three persons in painful feeling, the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to that and the underlying tendency to aversion in regard to that have not been abandoned.

original: na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. (Dukamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā duka mūlaka
translated: The underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasures in regard to that should not be said to have been abandoned or not to have been abandoned. (The fine-material and immaterial realms are to be treated in the same way.)

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha diṭṭhānusayo …pe… vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha diṭṭha anusayo pe vicikicchā anusayo appahīno ti natthi
translated: … and the underlying tendency to conceit are unabandoned, has the underlying tendency to views … to doubt also unabandoned? None have.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchānusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchā anusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā ati
translated: … or, where the underlying tendency to doubt is unabandoned, are the underlying tendencies to lust, hate, and conceit also unabandoned?

original: Puthujjanassa rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo ca mānānusayo
analyzed: puthujjanassa rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca māna anusayo
translated: In the case of an ordinary man in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to doubt and the underlying tendency to conceit are unabandoned there,

original: ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti
analyzed: ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayaḥ ca paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati
translated: but it cannot be said that the underlying tendencies to lust and hate are either abandoned or unabandoned there.

original: vā. Tasseva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo ca
analyzed: vā tassa iva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca
translated: In the case of that same person in the sense-sphere profitable and indeterminate dhammas and in the two kinds of unprofitable consciousness of the sense sphere, the underlying tendency to doubt and the underlying tendency to lust are unabandoned there,

original: kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā; paṭighānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā paṭigha anusayo na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā
translated: but it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to hate is either abandoned or unabandoned there.

original: “appahīno”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo
analyzed: appahīnaḥ ti vā tassa iva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo
translated: In the case of that same person in painful feeling, the underlying tendency to doubt and the underlying tendency to conceit are unabandoned there,

original: ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā.
analyzed: ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā
translated: and the underlying tendency to resistance has not been abandoned, then the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to conceit have either been abandoned or have not been abandoned.

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayo appahīno ti natthi
translated: If someone has not abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resistance and the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to an object, has he not abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for being in regard to that object? There is no such case.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnāti?🔽Mānānusayo appahīno; kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā.
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha bhava rāga anusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā ati  māna anusayaḥ appahīnaḥ kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā
translated: Or if someone has not abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for being in regard to an object, has he not abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resistance and the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to that object?🔽If someone has not abandoned the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to an object, then he has either abandoned or not abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resistance in regard to that object.

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha avijjā anusayo appahīno ti natthi
translated: If someone has not abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resistance and the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to an object, has he not abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to that object? There is no such case.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha avijjānusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha avijjā anusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā ati
translated: Or if someone has not abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to an object, has he not abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resistance and the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to that object?

original: Anāgāmissa rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha avijjānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā;
analyzed: anāgāmissa rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha avijjā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā
translated: In one who is a Non-Returner, the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit are unabandoned there,

original: kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tasseva
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayaḥ ca paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā tassa iva
translated: but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment are either unabandoned or abandoned.

original: puggalassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha avijjānusayo ca mānānusayo ca
analyzed: puggalassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha avijjā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca
translated: In one who is a Non-Returner, in the two kinds of feeling associated with the sensual-desire element, the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit are unabandoned there,

original: appahīnā, no ca tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo appahīno; paṭighānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti
analyzed: appahīnā no ca tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayaḥ appahīnaḥ paṭigha anusayaḥ na vattabbo pahīnoti
translated: but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires is either unabandoned or abandoned, and the underlying tendency to resentment is either unabandoned or abandoned.

original: vā “appahīno”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha avijjānusayo🔽appahīno, no ca tassa tattha paṭighānusayo appahīno; kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo🔽ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā
analyzed: vā appahīno ti vā tassa iva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha avijjā anusayo  appahīno no ca tassa tattha paṭigha anusayo appahīno kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo  ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā tiṇṇam puggalānam rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā
translated: In one who is a Non-Returner, in painful feeling, the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned there,🔽but the underlying tendency to resentment is either unabandoned or abandoned, and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to conceit are either unabandoned or abandoned.🔽In three kinds of persons, in the element of form and in the formless element,

original: tesaṁ tattha avijjānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo
analyzed: tesam tattha avijjā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo
translated: the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit are unabandoned there, but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment are either unabandoned or abandoned.

original: ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu
analyzed: ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā tesam eva puggalānam kāmadhātuyā dvīsu
translated: In the case of those same persons, in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit have been abandoned, but as to whether or not the underlying tendency to resentment has been abandoned, it should not be said either that it has or that it has not been abandoned.

original: vedanāsu tesaṁ tattha avijjānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā; paṭighānusayo🔽na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ dukkhāya vedanāya🔽tesaṁ tattha avijjānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo
analyzed: vedanāsu tesam tattha avijjā anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā paṭigha anusayo  na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā tesaṃ eva puggalānam dukkhāya vedanāya  tesam tattha avijjā anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo
translated: In the case of those same persons, in painful feeling,

original: ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. (Tikamūlakaṁ.)🔽Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā tikamūlaka  yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo appahīno ti natthi
translated: the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to resentment have been abandoned, but as to whether or not the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to conceit have been abandoned, it should not be said either that they have or that they have not been abandoned.🔽In the case of those same persons, in the two kinds of feeling in the fine-material and immaterial spheres, the underlying tendency to ignorance has been abandoned, but as to whether or not the underlying tendency to conceit has been abandoned, it should not be said either that it has or that it has not been abandoned.🔽In the case of those same persons, in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit have been abandoned, but as to whether or not the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resentment have been abandoned, it should not be said either that they have or that they have not been abandoned.🔽In the case of those same persons, in the two kinds of feeling in the fine-material and immaterial spheres, the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit have been abandoned, but as to whether or not the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resentment have been abandoned, it should not be said either that they have or that they have not been abandoned.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchānusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca appahīnāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha vicikicchā anusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca appahīnā ati
translated: In the case of those same persons, in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit have been abandoned, but as to whether or not the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resentment have been abandoned, it should not be said either that they have or that they have not been abandoned.🔽In the case of those same persons, in the two kinds of feeling in the fine-material and immaterial spheres, the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit have been abandoned, but as to whether or not the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to resentment have been abandoned, it should not be said either that they have or that they have not been abandoned

original: Puthujjanassa rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo ca mānānusayo
analyzed: puthujjanassa rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo ca māna anusayo
translated: In the case of an ordinary man, the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to conceit are unabandoned in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas.

original: ca diṭṭhānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti🔽vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha vicikicchānusayo
analyzed: ca diṭṭha anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati  vā appahīnā ati vā tassa iva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha vicikicchā anusayo
translated: The underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment are either unabandoned or abandoned.

original: ca kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca appahīnā; paṭighānusayo na vattabbo
analyzed: ca kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca appahīnā paṭigha anusayo na vattabbo
translated: In the case of that same person, the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to conceit and the underlying tendency to views are unabandoned in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere.🔽The underlying tendency to resentment is either unabandoned or abandoned.

original: “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha
analyzed: pahīnoti vā appahīnoti vā tassa iva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha
translated: In the case of that same person, the underlying tendency to uncertainty and the underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to views are unabandoned in painful feeling.

original: vicikicchānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca🔽mānānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā …pe…. (Catukkamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: vicikicchā anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca 🔽māna anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā pe
translated: The underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to conceit are either unabandoned or abandoned.

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayo appahīno ti natthi
translated: When someone has not abandoned the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to doubt in regard to a certain state, has he not abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for becoming in regard to that state? There is none.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha bhavarāgānusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnāti?🔽Tiṇṇaṁ puggalānaṁ rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tesaṁ tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha bhava rāga anusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā ati  tiṇṇam puggalānam rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tesam tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo
translated: Or when someone has not abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for becoming in regard to a certain state, has he not abandoned the underlying tendency to lust, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to doubt in regard to that state?

original: ca appahīnā, no ca tesaṁ tattha diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: ca appahīnā no ca tesam tattha diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo
translated: In the case of the three kinds of persons in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to lust for becoming and the underlying tendency to conceit are unabandoned in them in regard to that state, but the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to doubt are abandoned in them in regard to that state;

original: ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Puthujjanassa rūpadhātuyā
analyzed: ca paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā puthujjanassa rūpadhātuyā
translated: the underlying tendency to lust and the underlying tendency to aversion are neither to be said to be abandoned nor not to be said to be abandoned in them in regard to that state.

original: arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha bhavarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo
analyzed: arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha bhava rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo
translated: In the case of an ordinary man in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to lust for becoming, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to doubt are unabandoned in him in regard to that state,

original: ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā.
analyzed: ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayaḥ ca paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā
translated: and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to aversion have not been abandoned, it cannot be said that the underlying tendency to conceit has been abandoned or not abandoned there.

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha avijjā anusayo appahīno ti natthi
translated: When someone has not abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to doubt in regard to any given state, has he not abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to that state? There is none.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha avijjānusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha avijjā anusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā ati
translated: Or when someone has abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance in regard to any given state, has he also abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to aversion, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to doubt in regard to that state?

original: Anāgāmissa rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha avijjānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā,🔽no ca tassa tattha diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca
analyzed: anāgāmissa rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha avijjā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā  no ca tassa tattha diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca
translated: One who is a non-returner has not abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to the fine-material and immaterial dhammas,🔽but he has not abandoned the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to doubt in regard to them. He has not abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to aversion in regard to them.

original: paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā
analyzed: paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā tassa iva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā
translated: One who is a non-returner has not abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit in regard to the sensual dhammas,

original: dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha avijjānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā, no ca tassa tattha
analyzed: dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha avijjā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā no ca tassa tattha
translated: In the case of the two kinds of feeling, the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit have not been abandoned in him there,

original: kāmarāgānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā; paṭighānusayo na
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā paṭigha anusayo na
translated: but the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty have been abandoned in him there. The underlying tendency to resentment

original: vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa
analyzed: vattabbo pahīnoti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā tassa iva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa
translated: cannot be said to have been either abandoned or not abandoned in him there. In the case of painful feeling,

original: tattha avijjānusayo appahīno, no ca tassa tattha paṭighānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca
analyzed: tattha avijjā anusayo appahīno no ca tassa tattha paṭigha anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca
translated: the underlying tendency to ignorance has not been abandoned in him there, but the underlying tendency to resentment, the underlying tendency to views,

original: vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti🔽vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tesaṁ tattha avijjānusayo🔽ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā, no ca tesaṁ tattha diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca
analyzed: vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati  vā appahīnā ati vā dvinnam puggalānam rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tesam tattha avijjā anusayo  ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā no ca tesam tattha diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca
translated: and the underlying tendency to uncertainty have been abandoned in him there. The underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to conceit cannot be said to have been either abandoned or not abandoned in him there.🔽In the case of the two kinds of person in the fine-material and immaterial realms, the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit have not been abandoned in them there,

original: appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti
analyzed: appahīnā kāma rāga anusayaḥ ca paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati
translated: but the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to uncertainty have been abandoned in them there. The underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to resentment cannot be said to have been either abandoned or not abandoned in them there.

original: vā. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tesaṁ tattha avijjānusayo ca
analyzed: vā tesaṃ eva puggalānam kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tesam tattha avijjā anusayo ca
translated: In the case of these same three persons, in the two kinds of feeling in the sense sphere, their underlying tendency to ignorance and their underlying tendency to conceit are unabandoned,

original: kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā, no ca tesaṁ tattha diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā no ca tesam tattha diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo
translated: but their underlying tendency to views and their underlying tendency to uncertainty are abandoned.

original: ca appahīnā; paṭighānusayo na vattabbo “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ
analyzed: ca appahīnā paṭigha anusayo na vattabbo pahīnaḥ ti vā appahīnaḥ ti vā tesaṃ eva puggalāna
translated: But their underlying tendency to resentment cannot be said to be either abandoned or unabandoned. In the case of these same three persons,

original: dukkhāya vedanāya tesaṁ tattha avijjānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā, no ca tesaṁ🔽tattha diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya tesam tattha avijjā anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā no ca tesam  tattha diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo
translated: in painful feeling, their underlying tendency to ignorance and their underlying tendency to resentment are unabandoned,🔽but their underlying tendency to views and their underlying tendency to uncertainty are abandoned. Their underlying tendency to lust and their underlying tendency to conceit cannot be said to be either abandoned or unabandoned.

original: ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Puthujjanassa rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā
analyzed: ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā puthujjanassa rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā
translated: In the case of an ordinary man in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas,

original: tassa tattha avijjānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā;
analyzed: tassa tattha avijjā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā
translated: his underlying tendency to ignorance and his underlying tendency to conceit and his underlying tendency to views and his underlying tendency to uncertainty are unabandoned,

original: kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tasseva
analyzed: kāma rāga anusayaḥ ca paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā tassa iva
translated: but his underlying tendency to lust and his underlying tendency to resentment cannot be said to be either abandoned or unabandoned.

original: puggalassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha avijjānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: puggalassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha avijjā anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo
translated: In the case of the person in the sense-desire element, in the two kinds of feeling, ignorance-lust for existence,

original: ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā; paṭighānusayo na vattabbo
analyzed: ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā paṭigha anusayo na vattabbo
translated: and the underlying tendency to conceit, and the underlying tendency to false views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty are unabandoned by him there.🔽The underlying tendency to resistance is not to be spoken of as either abandoned or unabandoned.

original: “pahīno”ti vā “appahīno”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha
analyzed: pahīnoti vā appahīnoti vā tassa iva puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha
translated: In the case of the same person in painful feeling, ignorance-lust for existence,🔽and the underlying tendency to resistance, and the underlying tendency to false views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty are unabandoned by him there.

original: avijjānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: avijjā anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo
translated: The underlying tendency to lust for sense desires,

original: ca mānānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. (Pañcakamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: ca māna anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā
translated: and the underlying tendency to conceit are not to be spoken of as either abandoned or unabandoned.

original: Yassa yattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha avijjānusayo appahīnoti? Natthi.
analyzed: yassa yattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo ca appahīnā tassa tattha avijjā anusayo appahīno ti natthi
translated: In the case of anyone in whom the underlying tendency to lust for sense desires, and the underlying tendency to resistance, and the underlying tendency to conceit, and the underlying tendency to false views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty, and the underlying tendency to lust for existence are unabandoned, has the underlying tendency to ignorance been abandoned by him there? There is none.

original: Yassa vā pana yattha avijjānusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo ca appahīnāti?
analyzed: yassa vā pana yattha avijjā anusayo appahīno tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo ca appahīnā ati
translated: Or, where someone has not abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance, has he not abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to resentment, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, the underlying tendency to doubt, and the underlying tendency to lust for existence?

original: Anāgāmissa rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha avijjānusayo ca mānānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo
analyzed: anāgāmissa rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha avijjā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo
translated: In the case of one who is a non-returner, in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, he has not abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit,

original: ca appahīnā, no ca tassa tattha diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo🔽ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa
analyzed: ca appahīnā no ca tassa tattha diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo  ca paṭigha anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā tassa iva puggalassa
translated: but he has not abandoned the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to doubt. He has not abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires🔽and the underlying tendency to resentment.🔽In the case of that same person,

original: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha avijjānusayo ca mānānusayo ca appahīnā, no
analyzed: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha avijjā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca appahīnā no
translated: in the sense-sphere dhammas and in two of the feeling, he has not abandoned the underlying tendency to ignorance and the underlying tendency to conceit,

original: ca tassa tattha kāmarāgānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā; paṭighānusayo
analyzed: ca tassa tattha kāma rāga anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā paṭigha anusayo
translated: but he has not abandoned the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires and the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to doubt. He has not abandoned the underlying tendency to resentment.

original: ca bhavarāgānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa
analyzed: ca bhava rāga anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā tassa iva puggalassa
translated: and the underlying tendency to lust for existence should not be said to be either abandoned or unabandoned.

original: dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha avijjānusayo appahīno, no ca tassa tattha paṭighānusayo
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha avijjā anusayo appahīnaḥ no ca tassa tattha paṭigha anusayo
translated: In the case of the painful feeling of that person, the underlying tendency to ignorance is unabandoned, but the underlying tendency to resentment,

original: ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca
analyzed: ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca
translated: the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty are abandoned; and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to conceit,🔽and the underlying tendency to lust for existence should not be said to be either abandoned or unabandoned.

original: bhavarāgānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Dvinnaṁ puggalānaṁ🔽rūpadhātuyā arūpadhātuyā tesaṁ tattha avijjānusayo ca mānānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo
analyzed: bhava rāga anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā dvinnam puggalānam  rūpa dhātuyā arūpa dhātuyā tesam tattha avijjā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo
translated: In the case of the two kinds of persons

original: ca appahīnā, no ca tesaṁ tattha diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo
analyzed: ca appahīnā no ca tesam tattha diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo
translated: in the fine-material and immaterial dhammas, the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to conceit, and the underlying tendency to lust for existence are unabandoned, but the underlying tendency to views and the underlying tendency to uncertainty are abandoned; and the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires🔽and the underlying tendency to resentment should not be said to be either abandoned or unabandoned.

original: ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ
analyzed: ca paṭigha anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā tesaṃ eva puggalāna
translated: In the case of those very persons

original: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tesaṁ tattha avijjānusayo ca kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo
analyzed: kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tesam tattha avijjā anusayo ca kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo
translated: in the sensual dhammas and in the two kinds of feelings, the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, and the underlying tendency to conceit are unabandoned;

original: ca appahīnā, no ca tesaṁ tattha diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā; paṭighānusayo
analyzed: ca appahīnā no ca tesam tattha diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā paṭigha anusayo
translated: but their underlying tendency to view and their underlying tendency to doubt have not yet been abandoned there,

original: ca bhavarāgānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tesaññeva puggalānaṁ
analyzed: ca bhava rāga anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā tesañca eva puggalāna
translated: but their underlying tendency to resentment and their underlying tendency to delight in becoming need not be stated as either abandoned or unabandoned.

original: dukkhāya vedanāya tesaṁ tattha avijjānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca appahīnā, no ca tesaṁ
analyzed: dukkhāya vedanāya tesam tattha avijjā anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca appahīnā no ca tesam
translated: As to those same persons, their underlying tendency to ignorance and their underlying tendency to resentment have not yet been abandoned in painful feeling,

original: tattha diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo
analyzed: tattha diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo
translated: but their underlying tendency to view and their underlying tendency to doubt have not yet been abandoned there; but their underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasure, their underlying tendency to conceit,

original: ca bhavarāgānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Puthujjanassa rūpadhātuyā
analyzed: ca bhava rāga anusayaḥ ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā puthujjanassa rūpadhātuyā
translated: and their underlying tendency to delight in becoming need not be stated as either abandoned or unabandoned. As to ordinary people,

original: arūpadhātuyā tassa tattha avijjānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo
analyzed: arūpa dhātuyā tassa tattha avijjā anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo
translated: their underlying tendency to ignorance, their underlying tendency to conceit, their underlying tendency to view, their underlying tendency to doubt,

original: ca bhavarāgānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti
analyzed: ca bhava rāga anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati
translated: and their underlying tendency to delight in becoming have not yet been abandoned in the form element and in the formless element; but their underlying tendency to lust for sensual pleasure and their underlying tendency to resentment need not be stated as either abandoned or unabandoned there.

original: vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tasseva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha avijjānusayo
analyzed: vā appahīnā ati vā tassa iva puggalassa kāmadhātuyā dvīsu vedanāsu tassa tattha avijjā anusayo
translated: or “not yet abandoned”?

original: ca kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā;
analyzed: ca kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā
translated: In the case of that person, the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to conceit, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty are not yet abandoned in regard to the two kinds of feeling that are associated with the sensual desire element.

original: paṭighānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. Tasseva
analyzed: paṭigha anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā tassa eva
translated: The underlying tendency to resentment and the underlying tendency to lust for existence are either abandoned or not yet abandoned.

original: puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha avijjānusayo ca paṭighānusayo ca diṭṭhānusayo🔽ca vicikicchānusayo ca appahīnā; kāmarāgānusayo ca mānānusayo ca bhavarāgānusayo
analyzed: puggalassa dukkhāya vedanāya tassa tattha avijjā anusayo ca paṭigha anusayo ca diṭṭha anusayo  ca vicikicchā anusayo ca appahīnā kāma rāga anusayo ca māna anusayo ca bhava rāga anusayo
translated: In the case of that person, the underlying tendency to ignorance, the underlying tendency to resentment, the underlying tendency to views, and the underlying tendency to uncertainty are not yet abandoned in regard to painful feeling.🔽The underlying tendency to lust for sensual desires, the underlying tendency to conceit, and the underlying tendency to lust for existence are either abandoned or not yet abandoned.

original: ca na vattabbā “pahīnā”ti vā “appahīnā”ti vā. (Chakkamūlakaṁ.)
analyzed: ca na vattabbā pahīnā ati vā appahīnā ati vā chakkamūlaka
translated: (The six sections based on the root formula.)

original: Pahīnavāre paṭilomaṁ.
analyzed: pahīna vāre paṭiloma
translated: In the section on “abandoned,” the method is in reverse order.

original: Pahīnavāro.
analyzed: pahīna vāraḥ
translated: The section on “abandoned.”
